basics.name: Chawin Ophaswongse
basics.summary: Postdoctoral Fellow at the Robotics and Rehabilitation (RoAR) Lab, Columbia University. My research focuses on robotic assistance for seated postural control and neuromotor rehabilitation.

work.company: Robotics and Rehabilitation (RoAR) Lab, Columbia University
work.summary: Developing robotic torso exoskeletons and VR-based rehabilitation systems to improve seated postural coordination in individuals with spinal cord injuries.
Invented and evaluated robotic mechanisms for wheelchair users with trunk impairments.

work.company: Regional Center of Robotics Technologies, Chulalongkorn University
work.summary: Designed upper-limb rehabilitation robots for stroke patients.

work.company: Center of Excellence for Prosthetic and Orthopedic Implant, Chulalongkorn University
work.summary: Developed hydraulic knee prostheses using accessible components for cost-effective rehabilitation.
Established 3D component models for aviation maintenance using reverse engineering techniques.

education.area: M.S. in Mechanical Engineering (Robotics and Control)
